name: Peruvian Pickled Onions (Salsa Criolla)
author: Rich Girl 319
summary: A pretty simple recipe, quick and easy to prepare, salsa criolla is the perfect accompaniment to many dishes. The lime juice is what makes this onion salsa/relish special. It adds a bright flavor that sweetens the onions and livens up everything else on the plate. Great summer dish! Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
ingredients: 2  red onions, sliced very thinly into half moons
2 large English cucumbers, halved and sliced very thinly
1 large tomato, halved and thinly sliced
1  jalapeno pepper, sliced into very thin matchsticks, or more to taste  (Optional)
directions: Fill a bowl with water; stir in salt until dissolved
Add red onions; let soak for 10 minutes
Mix onions, cucumbers, tomato, rice vinegar, lime juice, white wine vinegar, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, olive, and black pepper together in a large bowl
Cover with plastic wrap and let marinate at room temperature before serving, about 30 minutes
